Which animal lacks the ability to see by sensing light?

When does electricity flow through a conductor?
Electricity only flows when a completed circuit path exists between the source (battery) and the load (light bulb). In an open circuit, electrons cannot flow because there is no path of least resistance. However, in a closed circuit, electrons can flow from the negative terminal to the positive terminal via the wire, and then to the load.

A. More
B. Less

If two objects have the same charge then what will they do to eachother?

If two objects with the same charge are brought near each other, there will be no electric force between them. This is because like charges repel each other. This is a fundamental property of electric charges. If two positively charged objects are brought together, they will repel each another, and if two negatively charged objects are brought together, they will also repel each other.

Animals cope with the differing temperatures in different ways. When its hot out, which animals pant?
When it's hot out, many animals pant to cool themselves down. Panting is a way for animals to increase their surface area (by opening their mouth and sticking out their tongues or panting rapidly) and allow heat to escape from their body more quickly. This is a common adaptation used by animals like dogs, cats, horses, and some types of birds, among others.
